metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Data Science - Regression Table: P-Value
The "Statistics of the Coefficients Part" in Regression Table
Now, we want to test if the coefficients from the linear regression function has a significant impact on the dependent variable (Calorie_Burnage).
content.html: Now, we want to test if the coefficients from the linear regression function has a significant impact on the dependent variable (Calorie_Burnage).

content.text: This means that we want to prove that it exists a relationship between Average_Pulse and Calorie_Burnage, using statistical tests.
content.html: This means that we want to prove that it exists a relationship between Average_Pulse and Calorie_Burnage, using statistical tests.

content.text: There are four components that explains the statistics of the coefficients:
content.html: There are four components that explains the statistics of the coefficients:

content.text: We will focus on understanding the "P-value" in this module.
content.html: We will focus on understanding the "P-value" in this module.

content.text: The P-value
The P-value is a statistical number to conclude if there is a relationship between Average_Pulse and Calorie_Burnage.
content.html: The P-value is a statistical number to conclude if there is a relationship between Average_Pulse and Calorie_Burnage.

content.text: We test if the true value of the coefficient is equal to zero (no relationship). The statistical test for this is called Hypothesis testing.
content.html: We test if the true value of the coefficient is equal to zero (no relationship). The statistical test for this is called Hypothesis testing.

content.text: Hypothesis Testing
Hypothesis testing is a statistical procedure to test if your results are valid.
content.html: Hypothesis testing is a statistical procedure to test if your results are valid.

content.text: In our example, we are testing if the true coefficient of Average_Pulse and the intercept is equal to zero.
content.html: In our example, we are testing if the true coefficient of Average_Pulse and the intercept is equal to zero.

content.text: Hypothesis test has two statements. The null hypothesis and the alternative hypothesis.
content.html: Hypothesis test has two statements. The null hypothesis and the alternative hypothesis.

content.text: Mathematically written:

content.code_html:
H0: Average_Pulse = 0
HA: Average_Pulse ≠ 0
H0: Intercept = 0
HA: Intercept ≠ 0

content.text: The sign ≠ means "not equal to"
Hypothesis Testing and P-value
The null hypothesis can either be rejected or not.
content.html: The null hypothesis can either be rejected or not.

content.text: If we reject the null hypothesis, we conclude that it exist a relationship between Average_Pulse and Calorie_Burnage. The P-value is used for this conclusion.
content.html: If we reject the null hypothesis, we conclude that it exist a relationship between Average_Pulse and Calorie_Burnage. The P-value is used for this conclusion.

content.text: A common threshold of the P-value is 0.05.
content.html: A common threshold of the P-value is 0.05.

content.text: Note: A P-value of 0.05 means that 5% of the times, we will falsely reject the null hypothesis. It means that we accept that 5% of the times, we might falsely have concluded a relationship.
content.html: Note: A P-value of 0.05 means that 5% of the times, we will falsely reject the null hypothesis. It means that we accept that 5% of the times, we might falsely have concluded a relationship.

content.text: If the P-value is lower than 0.05, we can reject the null hypothesis and conclude that it exist a relationship between the variables.
content.html: If the P-value is lower than 0.05, we can reject the null hypothesis and conclude that it exist a relationship between the variables.

content.text: However, the P-value of Average_Pulse is 0.824. So, we cannot conclude a relationship between Average_Pulse and Calorie_Burnage.
content.html: However, the P-value of Average_Pulse is 0.824. So, we cannot conclude a relationship between Average_Pulse and Calorie_Burnage.

content.text: It means that there is a 82.4% chance that the true coefficient of Average_Pulse is zero.
content.html: It means that there is a 82.4% chance that the true coefficient of Average_Pulse is zero.

content.text: The intercept is used to adjust the regression function's ability to predict more precisely. It is therefore uncommon to interpret the P-value of the intercept.
content.html: The intercept is used to adjust the regression function's ability to predict more precisely. It is therefore uncommon to interpret the P-value of the intercept.
